text: we're gonna bring you some breaking news
now that's been coming into us within
the last few minutes it has been
reported from Thailand that rescue
divers there have now located the 12
boys and their football coach who had
been trapped in flooded caves and have
found them alive
there had been no contact with the boys
who are aged between 11 and 16 since
they went missing with their coach nine
days ago that's a picture of the boys
with their coach a huge rescue effort
has been launched by the Thai
authorities it has been hampered by
heavy rains that had flooded that tham
luang cave in the north of the country
now the local governor there has said in
the last few minutes that the boys have
been found safe which is extraordinary
development really there had been
growing efforts to try to find them huge
resources brought in by the Thai
authorities and the Thai military
classmates of those 12 boys had been
really hoping for a miracle because
divers had been inching their way
through thick mud water winding crevices
trying to get to the air pocket where
they believe the group of boys and their
football coach were they brought in
pipes to pump out the water to keep the
water levels as low as possible there
had though been no contact at all with
the boys ever since they went missing
more than a week ago nine days ago it's
been an absolutely massive rescue effort
they've been British cave experts who've
also been drafted in and trying to help
those are some of the pipes you can see
that they've been using to pump out vast
amounts of water but they knew that more
heavy rains were coming later this week
so it has been a race against time by
the tile thora tees to try and bring
down the water levels and to reach the
boys and but they have now according to
the local governor they have reached the
boys and they are all alive we're not
sure what condition they're in clear
very unlikely they've had any any food
or clean drinking water for the last few
days that they've been in there but this
was the wild boar football team as it
was known and the school that they were
members of have said it's been a very
painful week that they've been praying
for the boys hoping against hope that
they would be found alive scores of
divers including foreign experts have
been sent to the cave they've taken with
them hundreds of oxygen tanks they've
had a base camp nearby and above ground
several teams have been drilling trying
to get into the labyrinth of darkened

difficult logistical operation relatives
if the boys have been camped out at the
caves entrance for more than a week
desperately waiting for the news of
their loved ones and now if this news is
right and is confirmed and it has come
from the governor of the province so
there's no reason to disbelieve it but
clearly those weary relatives who've
been there day-in day-out waiting and
praying will be absolutely elated with
this news the team of young footballers
and their assistant coach who's 25 years
old went into the cave back on June the
23rd this was after a training session
they then got cut off and they got stuck
in the caves when there were heavy rains
which cut them off from the entrance now
rescuers then found their bicycles they
found football boots they found
backpacks near the caves entrance they
then discovered handprints and
footprints further in so they did know
that they were there but those were
really the only signs of the boys and it
was a huge network of caves so very
difficult to locate exactly where they
were also know even if
were still alive but across Thailand
people have been maintaining hope and
belief that these boys might be found
alive and really its made news right
around the world not just in Thailand it
is likely that they did have some access
to fresh water in the cave and it's
possible that they may have taken some
snacks with them maybe even headlamps we
don't know but clearly if they have been
found alive and well which seems to be
the case that is a cause for great
rejoicing not only for their friends and
relatives and their classmates in their
school but all of Thailand and this is a
story that's going to go around the
world fantastic news if that is
confirmed we will bring you more details
